DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to use Radiostereometric Analysis (RSA) and clinical outcome measures to evaluate early, post-operative implant stability, post-operative implant fixation, clinical performance, and in-vivo wear of the Zimmer速 Continuum速 Cup with vitamin E stabilized polyethylene.
DOC.brief_title: A Prospective Radiostereometric Analysis and Clinical Evaluation of the Zimmer速 Continuum速 Acetabular Cup With Vitamin E Stabilized Polyethylene
DOC.criteria: Symptomatic osteoarthritis of the hip indicating surgical intervention Scheduled to undergo an uncemented total hip arthroplasty (THA) Patients between the ages of 18 and 65, inclusive Ability to give informed consent Patients will be available for followup for a minimum of 2 years after surgery Patients less than 18 years of age, or older than 65 years of age. Posttraumatic arthritis in the affected hip Rheumatoid arthritis in the affected hip Hip dysplasia in the affected hip Prior arthroplasty of the affected hip Active or prior infection of the affected hip Morbid obesity (BMI > 35) Medical condition precluding major surgery Severe osteoporosis or osteopenia Neuromuscular impairment Patients with known allergy to metals Pregnancy Patients with compromised kidney function Patient is immunosuppressed Patients that require a femoral head less than 32 mm or greater than 40mm.
